English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Could you close that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저걸 좀 닫아 줄 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): Close what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐를 닫아 줄까?

English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Could you close that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저걸 좀 닫아 줄 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): (Close the windows.)|(Close the doors on the bookshelf.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (창문을 닫는다.)|(책장 문을 닫는다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Could you close that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저걸 좀 닫아 줄 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): (Close the doors on the bookshelf.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (책장을 닫는다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Could you close that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저걸 좀 닫아 줄 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): (Close the windows.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (창문을 닫는다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Could you close that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 저걸 좀 닫아 줄 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, there’s nothing else to close...\nCould you be more specific?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 더는 닫을 게 없는데... \n더 구체적으로 말해 줄 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Sure, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): I was actually hoping you could close the door\nto my never-ending, suffocating thoughts.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사실은 끝도 없이 이어지는, 내 빌어먹을\n생각의 문을 닫아 주길 바랐어.

English (United States)(en-US): I saw someone today.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘은 어떤 사람을 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): What was that? Really, what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대체 그건 뭐였을까? 응?

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe you should calm down...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 조금 진정하는 게 좋을 것 같은데...

English (United States)(en-US): Why would he do that? Please, listen to this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대체 왜 그랬던 걸까? 조금 들어줄 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): ... That somehow resemble me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩐지 나를 닮은.

English (United States)(en-US): A black, black blob of waste. Something\nthat deserves to be destroyed.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검디 검은 폐기물 덩어리.\n역시 파쇄해 버려야 마땅한.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, get it together!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야. 정신 좀 차려 봐!

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, can you hear me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 정신이 좀 들어?

English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Did I show up strangely on your eyes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 안구에 내가 이상하게 비쳤어?

English (United States)(en-US): Well, a little... but I understand.|Not at all. Walk me through it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어어, 조금은 그랬지만... 난 널 이해할 수 있어.|조금도 그렇지 않아. 천천히 말해 줄 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): Thank you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고마워.

English (United States)(en-US): It was the first time I witnessed that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나로선 처음 보는 장면이었거든.

English (United States)(en-US): I didn’t believe ‘self-hate’ could\nmanifest in that way, as actions.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘자기 혐오’가 그런 행동으로\n나타날 수 있는지 몰랐어.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you know what the most\ntaboo subject is at the Factory?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공장에서 제일 터부시되는 게 뭔지 알아?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s ‘self-hate.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 바로 ‘자기 혐오’라는 감정.

English (United States)(en-US): The beings on the Moon are\nespecially afraid of suicide.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들은 인간의 자살을 특히 두려워해.

English (United States)(en-US): Why is that?|(Listen carefully.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어째서?|(묵묵히 들어준다.)

English (United States)(en-US): When self-hate manifests in ‘action,’\nthe worst-case scenario is suicide.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자기 혐오를 ‘행동’으로 옮기다 보면\n극단적으로 자살까지 할 수 있으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): They can’t even begin to understand how the\nhumans they love could feel such an emotion.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들의 아름다운 인간이 그런 감정을 느끼는\n걸 전혀 이해하지도 해석하지도 못해.

English (United States)(en-US): It terrifies them. They can’t\nbring themselves to face it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지극히 두려워해. 감히 마주보지도 못해.

English (United States)(en-US): I see... That’s why the Moon\nBeings try to prevent it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서... 달의 이들이 그걸 막으려고 하는 거구나.

English (United States)(en-US): For themselves.|For the humans.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들을 위해서.|인간을 위해서.

English (United States)(en-US): And... for the symbiotic relationship\nbetween humans and themselves.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고... 그들과 인간의 공생하는 관계를 위해서.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you see now? What\na horrible thing he did?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그가 지금 얼마나 끔찍한 일을 한 건지 알겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): That, that’s, the claw that smashes\nhuman souls’ protective barrier.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건, 그건, 인간 영혼의 보호막을 조각 내는 발톱.

English (United States)(en-US): The Moon Beings never let humans\nhurt themselves on principle.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들은 절대로 인간이\n자신을 해치게 두지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Never, ever, no matter what. And yet?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 절대, 결코, 그 어떤 일이 닥친대도. 그런데?

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t understand. He chose to do that?\nDid the Moon deliver a dream gone bad?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데? 이해가 안 되는 거야, 제 의지로 그런다고?\n상한, 혹은 썩은 꿈이 잘못 전달된 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): He chose to use that\nclaw and dig deep inside.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 발톱으로 내면의 엉킨 덩어리를\n스스로 긁어내는 인간이 있다니.

English (United States)(en-US): (Listen carefully.)|(No words come to mind.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (지금은 가만히 들어주기를 선택했다.)|(아무런 말도 떠오르지 않기에 할 수 없었다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Why? Why? I don’t want to\nknow. I don’t want to know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어째서? 어째서?\n알고 싶지 않아. 알고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): But <nickname>, do you know\nwhat scares me the most?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데, <nickname>. 지금 내가\n제일 무서운 게 뭔지 알아?

English (United States)(en-US): What do you think it is, <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너는 뭐라고 생각해?

English (United States)(en-US): Please don’t guess correctly.\nEven if you know the answer.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞히지 말아 줘. 눈치챘더라도.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve fallen down a rabbit hole.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 토끼 굴에 빠졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): When I came to my senses,\nI was already inside it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정신을 차린 순간, 그 안에 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t find my way out, but\nI also don’t know if I should...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 굴에서 나가는 법을 모르겠지만, 애초에,\n나가야 하는지조차 잘 모르겠어...

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing seems clear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어느 것도 제대로 보이지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m sorry. I need more time\nto think it over on my own.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미안. 오늘은 혼자서 더 생각해 보고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): Did he do those things\nbecause he hated himself?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 사람은 자기 자신을 싫어해서\n그런 행동을 한 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): Why did he hate himself\nand his life so much?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 사람은 왜 그렇게 자신과 삶을 싫어했을까?

English (United States)(en-US): What made him the way he is?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇이 그 사람을 그리 만들었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): As you know, that is what black does to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 알다시피, 나한테는 그게 검정이야.

English (United States)(en-US): No matter how many times I confront it,\nI can’t see color or potential. Black is just black.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무리 직시해도 어떠한 색채나 가능성이\n보이지 않아서. 검정은 그저 검정.

English (United States)(en-US): That void of worth and meaning feels\nfutile, sad, and sometimes terrifying.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 무가치함과 무의미함이 나를 허무하게,\n슬프게, 때로는 공포스럽게 해.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, do you ever feel like that?\nOr have you ever imagined what it’s like?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 혹시 너도 유사한 감정을 느껴?\n혹은 느낀 적이 있어? 상상해 본 적은 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Do you have your own black that hurts you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너를 아프게 하는 너만의 검정이 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Is that only on Earth?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 지구에만 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. At least I hope it only exists on Earth.|No, you can feel it anywhere in this universe.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 이런 건 오직 지구에만 있기를.|아니, 어디에서나 느낄 수 있을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): That wouldn’t exist on the Moon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에 가면 그런 건 없을 텐데.

English (United States)(en-US): I hope there will be nothing\non the Moon that can hurt him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 사람도 달에는 그를 아프게\n만드는 게 없었으면 좋겠다.

English (United States)(en-US): The universe is infinitely large. There should\nbe many spots to hide and take a moment.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주는 아주 아주 넓대. 잠깐\n숨어 쉬어갈 곳은 많을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I hope the universe feels\nkind to him, at the least.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 사람도 우주만큼은 다정한\n공간으로 여겼으면 좋겠다.

English (United States)(en-US): But <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): What would the Moon Beings think of him?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들이 그 사람을 보면 어떻게 생각할까?

English (United States)(en-US): They are very afraid of\nself-harming acts.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서는 인간이 자기를\n해치는 행동을 아주 무서워하는데.

English (United States)(en-US): They think all that self-hate and self-harm\nmakes you give up on yourself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 자기를 미워하고, 아프게 하는 행동을 계속하다\n보면 자기를 점차 포기하게 된다고 생각하거든.

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot is getting emotional.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치의 감정이 격해지는 게 느껴진다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Let’s observe for a while longer.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (조금만 더 지켜볼까.)

English (United States)(en-US): The Moon Beings would\nbe cautious of him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들이 그를 보면 다들 경계하겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): So the Moon won’t welcome him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 달은 그를 환영해 주지 못할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Worse than that. They would\ncertainly exclude him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 환영뿐만이 아니지. 아주, 아주, 배척할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): (I have to say something.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (더 이상은 지켜만 볼 수 없어.)

English (United States)(en-US): Is the Moon really that hostile?\nFrom what I’ve seen, you aren’t.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달이 정말 그렇게 차가운 곳이야?\n내가 봤던 뭉치는 그러지 않았는데.

English (United States)(en-US): Neither are the Moon Beings. In fact, they\nseem like warmly layered melodies to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달의 이들도 마찬가지야. 오히려 따스하게\n겹쳐 쌓인 선율 같은 이들이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, are you sure you want to\nkeep saying those things?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야, 너는 내일도 모레도\n같은 말을 하고 싶은 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Do you really want to exclude\nhim? So cruelly and heartlessly?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말로 그를 배척해 버리고\n싶은 거야? 무정하고, 가차없이?

English (United States)(en-US): N, no.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그, 그렇지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): You have to believe me.\nI never wanted that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 믿어 줘. 사실 난 그러고 싶었던 게 아니었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought so. Why couldn’t you\ntell me what you really feel?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 것 같다는 생각은 했어.\n네 진짜 마음을 말하지 못한 이유는 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t quite put it into words...\nit’s frustrating.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게... 명확하게 설명할\n수 없는 내가 참담해.

English (United States)(en-US): I saw two kinds of light in him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 그에게서 두 가지 빛을 보았지.

English (United States)(en-US): I saw destructive pain and the\nwill to live at the same time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파괴적인 고통과 삶에\n대한 의지를 동시에 보았어.

English (United States)(en-US): But it leaves me with\nan important question.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 의문이 남잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Why his actions\ncontradict his intentions.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 의도와 행동이 상반되는 이유가 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Hm...
(But Dot’s always observed conflict levelly.\nEven if they contradict each other...)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (하지만 뭉치는 늘 상반되는 상황을 투명히\n지켜봐 왔잖아. 그것이 서로 모순될지언정...)

English (United States)(en-US): (What’s so different about this time?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (이번엔 뭐가 다른 걸까?)

English (United States)(en-US): How can you want to live\nand still hurt yourself?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 살고 싶은데도 스스로를 해칠 수가 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Can you hate yourself to death\nand still not want to die?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽고 싶지 않아도 자기를\n죽도록 미워할 수 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): How? How? I don’t want to know. But if\nyou do know, please tell me, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어째서? 어째서? 알고 싶지 않아.\n하지만 알고 있다면 부디 알려 줘, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Just one of many contradictions.|(Remain silent with Dot.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 수많은 모순들 중 하나일 뿐이야.|(그저 함께 침묵한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): If he really wanted to die, he\nwould’ve used another method.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 죽고 싶었다면 다른 방법을 썼을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): He hated himself so because\nhe didn’t want to die.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이대로 죽고 싶지는 않기 때문에\n자기를 죽도록 미워한 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Or maybe the opposite. He hated himself,\nbut didn’t want to die in spite of it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 반대일지도. 죽도록 밉지만\n이대로 죽고 싶지는 않았던 나약한 마음...

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing is for sure. I won’t dare\nadd my thoughts to this situation.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇도 확실한 건 없어.\n감히 말을 얹고 싶지도 않고.

English (United States)(en-US): But I think I can say something\nas one of his species.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 인간으로서 하나 정도는\n말해 줄 수 있을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): It can happen. That’s all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말... ‘그럴 수도 있어.’ 그뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. It seems so.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래. 그런 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I need some time to myself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠깐의 시간이 필요해. 나에게는.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Everything feels wrong.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 어쩐지 모든 게 나빠지고 있는 느낌이야.

English (United States)(en-US): How so?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 그래?

English (United States)(en-US): My body seems to be getting\nlighter. As if it is evaporating.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜히 몸이 가벼워지고 있어.\n증발할 것 같은 기분이야.

English (United States)(en-US): But don’t worry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 신경 쓰지 마.

English (United States)(en-US): No need for further foreshadowing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 여기서 너를 더 불길하게 할 필요는 없겠지.
